On Mon, Fe=
b 15, 2010 at 2:15 PM, Loritsch, Berin C.
<berin.loritsch@...> wrote=
:
> I created a set of theories to verify the equals(), hashCode()
> relati=
onship. =A0While I had the equals and reciprocal equals working
> properly,=
 I was surprised at the unintended hashCode collisions I had in
> my code. =
=A0More importantly I was surprised at how often the @DataPoints
> method w=
as called to set up the tests. =A0It was called no less than 61
> times for=
 60 discrete data points. =A0That seems a bit excessive to me.
>
> I set up=
 a bunch of data with the assumption that it was set up once,
> and then th=
e contents were copied as needed. =A0Essentially the expensive
> set up wor=
k is done 61 times, accounting for a large portion of the 37
> seconds it t=
akes to run all my tests. =A0If the @DataPoints method is only
> called onc=
e, and the values are copied as necessary, then the
> implementation would =
be much faster.
>
